subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I'm just curious..where do you conduct your Ghost box sessions?
author: Ursula Kalin

I like what you said Tim and I agree :)

--- On Tue, 12/14/10, Tim Woolwort=
h <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@gmail.c=
om>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I'm just curious..where do you conduct your =
Ghost box sessions?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, December 14,=
 2010, 4:49 PM


=C2=A0 




I agree that the voices come to you in your ho=
me, I think we can all agree on that.


As a ghost hunter, locations allow =
you access to voices that would otherwise never find you. =C2=A0I am not su=
re why this is, but it seems that the spirits like to hang around certain a=
reas. =C2=A0I know that radius has nothing to do with it because I have bee=
n on hunts hundreds of miles from my house and I get the same voices I have=
 at home. =C2=A0I have also been on hunts far from my home where I met some=
one new on the other side that was there again when I turned my box on at t=
he house!


I love the idea of doing GBC at home and I try to get in at lea=
st 2 sessions a week. =C2=A0But, going to a location has its perks too. =C2=
=A0You can find out names and historical facts that you wouldn't know other=
wise. =C2=A0If you go to a place it seems like you announce yourself to a n=
ew group of people when you turn on your box, and you never know, those peo=
ple might stick with you for a while.


It has always puzzled me how they r=
ecognize me when I am on no matter where I am. =C2=A0One of the greatest pi=
eces of evidence we can gather is having the same voice communicate with yo=
u in different parts of the country.


As it has been stated before, you ca=
n use a box anywhere there is a radio station and you'll get something. =C2=
=A0But, the more places you travel too, the more access you have to a growi=
ng chorus of voices.


Tim




On Tue, Dec 14, 2010 at 5:39 PM, Frank Sumpt=
ion <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




Yeah, about 99%.
=C2=
=A0
F-



On Tue, Dec 14, 2010 at 3:35 PM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@sbcglobal.n=
et> wrote:


=C2=A0 







very true Frank...so do you do=C2=A0 it mostly =
in your home ?..your sessions that is.

--- On Tue, 12/14/10, Frank Sumptio=
n <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengir=
l@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I'm just curious..where do you cond=
uct your Ghost box sessions?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, Dec=
ember 14, 2010, 4:05 PM 



=C2=A0 


=C2=A0I, as a rule, don't go to haunt=
ed locations.=C2=A0For one thing, don't like that creepy walking through sp=
ider web feeling at some of these places.=C2=A0 Second, spirits and entitie=
s travel, they will come to you. 
=C2=A0
F-S=C2=A0


On Tue, Dec 14, 2010 a=
t 12:48 AM, Adriana Jones <adrianamjones@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



For=
 me its mainly at home, because I'm a homebody I love home... and the added=
 bonus with that is that you get to see how amazing the ghost box is even w=
hen you're not in "haunted" locations. The most calls for help I've ever go=
tten have been just sitting at home on my bed... it's just simply amazing. =
My sessions are one to two times a week... 


--- In EVP-ITC@...=
m, "Ursula" <kalinu@...> wrote:
>
> I was just wondering weather it be in y=
our home in the park etc? and how often..
>

<DIV><BR>I agree that the voices come to you in your =

<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>As a ghost hun=
ter, locations allow you access to voices that would otherwise never find y=
ou.  I am not sure why this is, but it seems that the spirits like to =
hang around certain areas.  I know that radius has nothing to do with =
it because I have been on hunts hundreds of miles from my house and I get t=
he same voices I have at home.  I have also been on hunts far from my =
home where I met someone new on the other side that was there again when I =
turned my box on at the house!</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I love the idea o=
f doing GBC at home and I try to get in at least 2 sessions a week.  B=
ut, going to a location has its perks too.  You can find out names and=
 historical facts that you wouldn't know otherwise.  If you go to a pl=
ace it seems like you announce yourself to a new group of people when you t=
urn on your box, and you never know, those people might stick with you for =
a while.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>It has always puzzled me how they recog=
nize me when I am on no matter where I am.  One of the greatest pieces=
 of evidence we can gather is having the same voice communicate with you in=
 different parts of the country.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>As it has been =
stated before, you can use a box anywhere there is a radio station and you'=
ll get something.  But, the more places you travel too, the more acces=
s you have to a growing chorus of voices.</DIV>
